name: Power to avoid transfers
text: §560:3-710  Power to avoid transfers.  The property liable for the payment of unsecured debts of a decedent includes all property transferred by the decedent by any means which is in law void or voidable as against the decedent's creditors, and subject to prior liens, the right to recover this property, so far as necessary for the payment of unsecured debts of the decedent, is exclusively in the personal representative. [L 1996, c 288, pt of §1]
